item.title: C++ Inherited Properties
item.description: Inheritance In Python & JavaScript Link to heading So here’s a fun thing that bit me on my C++ learning journey. In my previous experience with Python, it was (relatively) common to set a property (or properties) on a base class, then make use of that property within the methods of that base class. class Base: def __init__(self): self.some_int = 0 def get_int(self): return self.some_int For derived classes, we could simply override the property.
